channel.title: FAQs Archive - Web Design and Printing

item.title: How long does it take to create a website?
item.dc:creator: oliver
item.description:
The average time to build a website is three weeks after all the content was approved. For complex websites the time will change to six to eight weeks.

The post How long does it take to create a website? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.
item.content:encoded:
The average time to build a website is three weeks after all the content was approved. For complex websites the time will change to six to eight weeks.

The post How long does it take to create a website? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.

item.title: I have a website, why I don’t receive calls?
item.dc:creator: oliver
item.description:
The most common reasons are slow loading of the website, no call-to-action content, visitors can't find what they are looking for.

The post I have a website, why I don’t receive calls? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.
item.content:encoded:
The most common reasons are slow loading of the website, no call-to-action content, visitors can’t find what they are looking for.

The post I have a website, why I don’t receive calls? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.

item.title: I need a website, where do I start?
item.dc:creator: oliver
item.description:
This is probably the most asked question. To start you need two things: a domain name (ie. mywebsite.com) and a webserver to host your website and make it available 24/7. You can buy a domain name from any domain registrar like Google Domains. Web hosting is available from many companies like Amazon, Google, Digital Ocean [...]

The post I need a website, where do I start? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.
item.content:encoded:
This is probably the most asked question. To start you need two things: a domain name (ie. mywebsite.com) and a webserver to host your website and make it available 24/7. You can buy a domain name from any domain registrar like Google Domains. Web hosting is available from many companies like Amazon, Google, Digital Ocean and it should be purchased after a web domain was acquired.

The post I need a website, where do I start? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.

item.title: What is responsive web design?
item.dc:creator: oliver
item.description:
In simple terms, responsive web design is a website that displays in a user-friendly mode on any size screen, especially a smartphone.

The post What is responsive web design? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.
item.content:encoded:
In simple terms, responsive web design is a website that displays in a user-friendly mode on any size screen, especially a smartphone.

The post What is responsive web design? appeared first on Web Design and Printing.
